H0.text: Nervous tissue is the fourth basic type of tissue, along with epithelial, muscle, and connective.

H1.text: Regulatory is the fourth basic type of tissue, completing the set of epithelial, muscle, and connective tissues.

H2.text: Digestive is the fourth basic type of tissue, along with epithelial, muscle, and connective.

H3.text: Circulatory is the fourth basic type of tissue, alongside epithelial, muscle, and connective.

A4.text: Animal tissues are grouped into four basic types: connective, muscle, nervous, and epithelial.
